subject: Writing
title: Lennon and McCartney of Screenwriting: Goldman and Towne
description: A quick win: understand Lennon and McCartney of Screenwriting: Goldman and Towne.

hook.text: William Goldman said: 'Nobody knows anything.' Robert Towne said: 'The best scripts are about what's not said.'

buildup.text: Goldman (Butch Cassidy, All the President's Men) and Towne (Chinatown) dominated 1970s Hollywood screenwriting.

discovery.text: Goldman believed in surprising audiences with plot. Towne believed in layering subtext beneath every scene.

twist.text: They represented opposite philosophies â€” yet both produced masterpieces. There's no single path to great screenwriting.

climax.text: Together, they defined what a 'great screenplay' meant for an entire generation of Hollywood writers.

punchline.text: Two opposite approaches. Both right. Nobody knows anything.

quiz.question: What was William Goldman's famous quote about Hollywood?
